body:
Comment 9 by **grahamalexanderharris**: 
Thank you, that did it!
For anyone in the future with this problem, I compiled the go compiler after "export
GOARM=5" (to avoid a crash) and replacing /boot/start.elf with /boot/arm224_start.elf
(to make enough memory available). All tests passed except for "math/rand" which timed
out (known issue) and "gob" which ran out of memory (also a known issue).
There was no swap partition at the time.
This should work (I think) on both model A and B Raspberry Pi's, as they both have
~256MB of physical RAM.
